title: Data Developer and Analyst
loc: Mid-America Regional Council
description_1: Created a data pipeline to monitor the COVID-19 pandemic that was used as the primary emergency response tool for the Kansas City region. This included automating the collection of source data coming from local, state, and federal government entities, clean and consolidate the data in SQL databases, and creating dashboard-based website that was was used to inform regional response, media outlets, and the general public.
description_2: Created a data pipeline to monitor the COVID-19 pandemic that was used as emergency response tool for the Kansas City region\nsb-Used R and Python to scrape and clean data, SQL databases to store it, and R, ArcGIS, and PowerBi products to visualize and deliver data to the public\nsb-Developed a Shiny application to manage all inputs and outputs in a controlled fashion, ensuring data accuracy and reporting
description_3: Developed organizational R and Python packages that work to mirror common tasks done day to day so that cross-training and switching languages is less burdensome and reduces technical debt
description_4: Created technical  documentation that standardized data storage and documentation practices, software environment setup, and tips for using Python and R in the same project
description_5: Created a system that uses Bash and Arrow to quickly filter and summarize terabytes of transportation movement data
description_6: Managed collaborative data sharing relationships with City, County, State, and Federal government agencies
description_7: Created a procedure to securely  store authentication credentials in a common location that can be accessed by any of our scripts and scheduled tasks
